title: European Leaders Present Ukraine Security Plan in DC, Trump Noncommittal
snippets: European leaders join Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington, DC for talks.
A repeated refrain from European leaders during remarks ahead of their meeting was the need for security guarantees for Ukraine.
Document seen by the FT lays out Kyiv’s proposals to US president at crucial White House meeting
President Trump has not committed to adding American forces to the mix in Ukraine. No one has detailed publicly what form defenses would take, but there are several options.
titles: Are US security guarantees enough to end the war in Ukraine?
WATCH:  President Trump pressed on security guarantees for Ukraine
Ukraine offers $100bn weapons deal to Trump to win security guarantees
What ‘Security Guarantees’ in Troop Form Could Look Like in Ukraine
summary: European leaders met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington, DC, emphasizing the need for security guarantees for Ukraine. A document outlining Kyiv's proposals was presented to the US President at a significant White House meeting. However, President Trump has not committed to deploying American forces in Ukraine, and the specifics of the proposed defenses remain undisclosed.

title: Newsmax Settles Dominion Lawsuit for $67M Over Election Fraud Claims
snippets: The right-wing news channel Newsmax has agreed to pay $67 million to Dominion Voting Systems over its coverage of the 2020 presidential election. A trial had been scheduled for October.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxNVFVqUTl4QUhjNXhrMFd0LUpSdlRYcWxFVFFCbVFyNDc3SERWX1dDdUFJOE1Tc09VbEtkYzZJRmpQWXN1WG9oZGFIM0kwSEtHY0pVeUlCNElHaFYyM0JMdHZkWS1Qbm9udl9JN2ZRVGNKVTh6X25UTVZ4ZzNiZ1JHdGxYM24wWVVGSnc?oc=5" target="_blank">Newsmax and Dominion settle lawsuit over
Newsmax claimed its coverage was "fair, balanced, and conducted within professional standards of journalism," even though a judge ruled it had defamed Dominion Voting Systems.

DENVER (AP) — The conservative network Newsmax will pay $67 million to settle a lawsuit accusing it of defaming a voting equipment company by spreading lies about President Donald Trump’s 2020 election loss, according to documents filed Monday. The settlement comes after Fox News Channel paid $787.5
titles: Newsmax pays $67 million to settle defamation case linked to 2020 election coverage
Newsmax and Dominion settle lawsuit over 2020 election lies - Axios
Newsmax avoids trial with $67 million settlement over false 2020 election claims
Conservative network Newsmax agrees to pay $67M in defamation case over bogus 2020 election claims
summary: Newsmax agreed to pay Dominion Voting Systems $67 million to settle a lawsuit concerning its coverage of the 2020 presidential election. This settlement was reached ahead of a scheduled October trial. The lawsuit was related to false claims about voting machine fraud, which have been continuously promoted by former President Donald Trump.

title: Hamas Agrees to Ceasefire, Hostage Release in 60-Day Deal
snippets: The proposal from regional mediators would see Israeli hostages released in two batches during a 60-day truce, according to a Palestinian official.
A Hamas source told Al Jazeera the group has agreed terms for a ceasefire in Gaza, as a step towards ending the war.

Deal would include 60-day halt to violence and exchange of half of living Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners

Hamas officials say they have accepted a proposal for a Gaza ceasefire deal that would include the release of half of the approximately 20 remaining living Israeli hostages a
It was unclear whether Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel was on board with the terms, which came as Qatar and Egypt were intensifying mediation efforts.
titles: Hamas source says group agrees to latest Gaza ceasefire proposal

Hamas accepts latest Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal proposal - Axios
Hamas says it accepts proposal for Gaza ceasefire and release of hostages
Hamas Accepts New Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal, Officials Say
summary: Hamas has agreed to a ceasefire and hostage deal proposed by regional mediators, which includes the release of Israeli hostages in two phases over a 60-day period, as confirmed by a Palestinian official. This development aims to establish a truce in the region.

title: Trump Plans Trilateral Meeting on Ukraine Security After Talks with Putin
snippets: President Donald Trump was asked in the Oval Office about security guarantees for Ukraine and whether that will involve the U.S.
Trump's discussions with Zelenskyy come after he met with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday.
"After that meeting takes place, we will have a Trilat, which would be the two Presidents, plus myself."
titles: Trump-Zelenskyy live updates: Trump says Putin-Zelenskyy meeting being planned
Trump Says He Called Putin To Make ‘Arrangements’ For Putin-Zelenskyy Meeting (Live Updates)
Trump says he’s arranging for Putin and Zelenskyy to meet face to face, followed by meeting of all 3 presidents
summary: President Donald Trump discussed security guarantees for Ukraine in the Oval Office, following his recent meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Trump mentioned that after his upcoming meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, a trilateral meeting (Trilat) involving himself, Zelenskyy, and Putin will occur. This aims to address security concerns involving the U.S. and Ukraine.

title: Stars Negotiate Deals; Hendrickson's Bengals Future in Question
snippets: Both stars will have some catching up to do when/if their deals get resolved.
They reportedly agree on length of deal and total value.

summary: Two stars are in negotiations for their deals, having agreed on the duration and total value. Discussions continue around the potential outcomes of Trey Hendrickson's hold-out with the Bengals, including speculation on a possible trade before the 2025-26 season begins.

title: Leeds United Beats Everton 1-0 with Late Nmecha Penalty
snippets: A late penalty from summer signing Lukas Nmecha helps Leeds United win their opening match on their return to the Premier League as they beat Everton 1-0 at Elland Road.
Leeds take a late lead at Elland Road against Everton.
Jack Grealish was unable to inspire Everton after going on as a second-half substitute for his debut in a 1-0 loss to promoted Leeds in the Premier League on Monday.
titles: Late penalty gives Leeds win against Everton on Premier League return
LATE DRAMA as penalty controversy gives Leeds late goal against Everton!
Grealish debuts for Everton in loss at promoted Leeds in Premier League
summary: Lukas Nmecha's late penalty secured Leeds United a 1-0 victory over Everton in their Premier League return at Elland Road. Despite Jack Grealish's debut as a second-half substitute for Everton, he couldn't prevent the loss. This win marks a successful start for Leeds in the league.

title: "Jasveen Sangha to Plead Guilty in Ketamine Case Linked to Matthew Perry's Death
snippets: The American-British dual-national is one of five people who were charged with supplying ketamine to the actor.
The woman known as the "ketamine queen" has agreed to plead guilty to supplying the drug that killed "Friends" actor Matthew Perry, according to prosecutors.

Jasveen Sangha, fifth and last defendant charged in Friends star’s overdose to strike plea agreement with prosecutors

A woman known as the “ketamine queen”, charged with selling Matthew Perry the drug that killed him, agreed to plead guilty on Monday.

Jasveen Sangha becomes the fifth
titles: 'Ketamine Queen' to plead guilty in Matthew Perry overdose case
Woman to plead guilty over drug that killed Matthew Perry
‘Ketamine queen’ accused of selling Matthew Perry fatal dose to plead guilty
summary: Jasveen Sangha, dubbed the "ketamine queen" and an American-British dual-national, has agreed to plead guilty to supplying ketamine that resulted in the death of "Friends" actor Matthew Perry. She is the fifth and final defendant to reach a plea agreement with prosecutors regarding the case.

title: Zelensky, Trump, and Global Leaders Meet for Ukraine Peace Talks
snippets: White House asks if Zelensky will wear a suit to meet Trump &n

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifEFVX3lxTE5ZaUVBd2ZUTnd5TlJzT0hhcGxjUHRYSXhmX29uX0E5RG40SUlxc1JjVjhybnRmUEJ4QTRLaTlpZzZyenpnSDVPTlhTSmMyNnNMR0RHZVVaZ0tOblF6dmE3YVEyYmFWZWlmdUVKempWWUt6UDZ0MDFHQ0U5Mmo?oc=5" target="_blank">These European leaders will accompany Zelensky to meet with
The high-stakes gathering comes as Trump presses for a peace deal to end the war in Ukraine after Russia launched its full-scale invasion in 2022.
President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that a full prisoner exchange was also essential to ending the war. Other European leaders also expressed their support for a cease-fire.
titles: White House asks if Zelensky will wear a suit to meet Trump - Axios
These European leaders will accompany Zelensky to meet with Trump - Axios
What to expect as Zelensky, European leaders meet Trump at White House
Live Updates: Zelensky and European Leaders Press for Security Guarantees in Meeting With Trump
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to meet with former President Donald Trump at the White House, accompanied by European leaders, heads of NATO, and the European Commission. This high-profile meeting aims to discuss a peace deal to end the ongoing war in Ukraine, which began with Russia's full-scale invasion in 2022. The meeting underscores the international effort to secure peace in the region, with US security guarantees also in focus as Trump suggests Kyiv could end the war "almost immediately."

title: Trump Plans Executive Order to Ban Mail-In Voting, Legal Experts Disagree
snippets: But legal experts say he lacks the constitutional authority to do so.
Trump's action comes after his meeting with Vladimir Putin in Anchorage, where the Russian leader told him that mail-in ballots led to his electoral defeat in 2020, Trump said.
titles: Trump wants to stop states from voting by mail and using voting machines
On Putin's advice, Trump launches assault on mail-in ballots and voting machines
summary: Former President Trump announced plans to issue an executive order banning mail-in voting, citing discussions with Vladimir Putin, who claimed mail-in ballots caused Trump's 2020 electoral defeat. However, legal experts assert Trump does not have the constitutional authority to enforce such a ban.

title: Justin Jefferson Returns to Vikings Practice After 25-Day Injury Absence
snippets: Minnesota Vikings receiver Justin Jefferson practiced Monday for the first time in 25 days as he continues to recover from the strained left hamstring he suffered last month.
Justin Jefferson has rejoined the Minnesota Vikings for practice, after a mild strain of his left hamstring kept him sidelined for three and a half weeks.
titles: Vikings' Jefferson back at practice after 25 days
Jefferson returns to Vikings practice in ramp-up to regular season
summary: Minnesota Vikings receiver Justin Jefferson returned to practice after being out for 25 days due to a strained left hamstring. He participated in practice after missing three and a half weeks due to the injury.

title: Phillies' Zack Wheeler Undergoes Successful Surgery for Arm Blood Clot
snippets: Philadelphia Phillies ace Zack Wheeler had surgery Monday to remove a blood clot in his upper right arm, and the team says a timeline for his recovery remains uncertain.
Wheeler had a successful procedure on Monday
titles: Phils' Wheeler undergoes surgery; timeline unclear
Zack Wheeler return timeline unclear as Phillies ace undergoes surgery to remove blood clot
summary: Philadelphia Phillies pitcher Zack Wheeler underwent surgery to address a blood clot in his upper right arm. The procedure was successful, but his recovery timeline is currently unknown.

title: Trump Hosts Zelenskyy at White House to Discuss Ukraine War Resolution
snippets: President Trump welcomed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to the White House as Trump continues to push for a deal to end the war in Ukraine.
President Trump has downplayed the need for a ceasefire agreement, but if there isn't a one "before those peace agreement talks, then the killing will just keep going," ABC News' Martha Raddatz says.
Leaders’ warm meeting in the White House comes six months after February fiasco
titles: WATCH:  President Trump and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy meet in Oval Office
WATCH:  President Trump meets with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and European leaders
A letter for Melania and a suit: Zelenskyy charms Trump in the Oval
summary: President Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the White House, aiming to negotiate an end to the war in Ukraine. Despite Trump's minimal emphasis on a ceasefire, ABC News' Martha Raddatz highlighted its necessity to halt ongoing violence prior to peace talks. This significant meeting occurred six months after a previous diplomatic mishap in February, marking a warm reception between the leaders as they seek a resolution to the conflict.

title: Trump, Zelenskyy Differ on Ceasefire Necessity in Ukraine War Talks
snippets: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy revealed key details of his private White House meeting with Donald Trump.
Donald Trump talked down the need for a ceasefire to end the Ukraine war as he greeted Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
Trump has said a ceasefire wasn't necessary at this stage, while Zelenskyy thanked the US president for efforts to "stop killings." Follow DW for the latest.
titles: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy reveals key details of private meeting with Trump
Trump downplays need for ceasefire before private Zelenskyy meeting
Ukraine: Zelenskyy hails 'best' talks with Trump yet
summary: During a private White House meeting, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy discussed the Ukraine war with Donald Trump. Trump expressed that a ceasefire was not necessary at this stage, contrasting with Zelenskyy's gratitude towards Trump's efforts to halt the conflict. This encounter highlights differing views on the need for a ceasefire to end the war.

title: Hurricane Erin Spurs Tropical Storm Watch in North Carolina
snippets: Tropical storm conditions and coastal flooding are expected to appear in areas along the Outer Banks starting late Wednesday.
Though Hurricane Erin will not make landfall in the U.S., here's why a tropical storm watch has been issued for parts of North Carolina.
titles: Hurricane Erin: Storm surge watch is issued for North Carolina's Outer Banks
Hurricane Erin Prompts Tropical Storm Watch For North Carolina
summary: Tropical storm conditions and coastal flooding are anticipated along the Outer Banks of North Carolina starting late Wednesday due to Hurricane Erin. Although Erin is not expected to make landfall in the U.S., a tropical storm watch has been issued for parts of North Carolina as a precaution.

title: Oscar Piastri to Have Grandstand Named After Him at Australian Grand Prix
snippets: Formula 1 championship leader Oscar Piastri will be able to zoom past his own grandstand in next year's Australian Grand Prix at Melbourne's Albert Park.  The Australian GP announced late Monday that the Piastri Grandstand would be located on the main straight, opposite pit lane.  The 24-year-old Pi
Formula 1 championship leader Oscar Piastri will be able to zoom past his own grandstand in next year’s Australian Grand Prix at Melbourne’s Albert Park.

The Piastri Grandstand will be situated on the main straight, opposite the pit lane, allowing the 24-year-old Australian racer to pass directly in front of his supporters.

Angeli, who transferred from Notre Dame in April, spent three seasons with the Fighting Irish before making the move. This decision marks a significant step in his collegiate football career as he prepares to lead Syracuse in the upcoming season.

title: Alcaraz Wins Cincinnati Open as Sinner Retires Due to Illness
snippets:
• Italian trailing 0-5 when he decided to pull out

  • Alcaraz confident rival is ‘going to come back stronger’

Carlos Alcaraz has won the Cincinnati Open for the first time in his career after the world No 1, Jannik Sinner, his great rival, was forced to retire f
Check this out, as top seeded Jannik Sinner was forced to retire due to illness in the Cincinnati Open final, handing 2nd seeded Carlos Alcaraz the title.
The latest entry in the burgeoning Carlos Alcaraz-Jannik Sinner rivalry wasn’t quite the epic with which tennis fans have become accustomed.
titles: Carlos Alcaraz wins Cincinnati Open as Sinner retires from final with illness

Alcaraz wins Cincinnati Open after Sinner retires with illness
summary: Carlos Alcaraz won the Cincinnati Open for the first time after his opponent, world No. 1 Jannik Sinner, retired due to illness during the final. At the time of retirement, Sinner was trailing 0-5. Alcaraz, the second seed, was confident that Sinner would come back stronger. This event marks a significant moment in the ongoing rivalry between Alcaraz and Sinner, although this match did not live up to the epic encounters expected by fans.

This development followed a call to Putin and a statement to Ukraine's Zelenskyy, indicating that a ceasefire was not necessary. The discussions and subsequent actions highlight efforts to address security concerns in Ukraine and engage directly with Russia on these issues.

title: Danish Firm Cuts Ozempic Price; Stock Rises

summary: Danish pharmaceutical company announced a reduction in the price of Ozempic, a diabetes medication, to $499 per month for three dose sizes for patients without insurance. This pricing is available through the company's direct-to-consumer pharmacy and GoodRx, among other platforms. Following this announcement, the company's stock price increased.

title: New Studies Unveil Bearded Dragon Genomes, Boosting Research and Conservation
snippets: Two different studies published in GigaScience present the near-complete reference genomes of the central bearded dragon (Pogona vitticeps), a widely distributed species of dragon lizard common in central eastern Australia and popular as pets in Europe, Asia, and North America. This species has an u
titles: Double dragons help explain sex determination of reptiles
summary: Two studies published in GigaScience have presented near-complete reference genomes of the central bearded dragon, a species common in central eastern Australia and popular as pets globally. These genomes will aid in research on the species' unique traits and conservation efforts.

title: Breakthrough Psoriasis Treatment Balances Immunity, Reduces Side Effects
titles: Psoriasis Breakthrough: Scientists Restore Immune Balance Without Harsh Side Effects
summary: Scientists have achieved a breakthrough in treating psoriasis by restoring immune balance without causing harsh side effects. This advancement could significantly improve the quality of life for individuals suffering from chronic psoriasis skin inflammation, offering a more effective and gentler treatment option.

title: Mount Everest Air Study Finds Potential Parkinson's Treatment Molecules
titles: Mount Everest Air Offers Clues to Parkinson’s Treatment
summary: Researchers studying the air at Mount Everest's base camp have discovered molecules that could lead to a new treatment for Parkinson's disease. The study, published in a scientific journal, found that the unique environmental conditions at high altitudes might help identify compounds beneficial in managing or treating Parkinson's symptoms. This discovery opens up potential pathways for developing novel therapeutic strategies against the disease.

title: Genome Editing Shows Promise and Risks in Disease Treatment
snippets: The ability to correct disease-causing genetic mistakes using genome editors holds great promise in medicine, but it is not without risk. When this type of "genetic surgery" is performed on DNA, for instance, there is always the danger of leaving permanent genetic scars that may even be heritable.
titles: RNA editing tool can take some of the risk out of gene therapy
summary: Genome editing offers significant medical potential by fixing genetic errors that cause diseases. However, it carries risks, including the possibility of causing permanent and potentially heritable genetic alterations. This highlights the need for caution and further research in the application of genetic editing technologies.

titles: Sienna Announces Offering of $175 Million of 4.112% Series E Senior Unsecured Debentures and Closing of Previously Announced Acquisition in Greater Toronto Area

title: NASA's Johnson Space Center: A Haven for Wildlife and Space Exploration

It might be a surprise to learn you can also spy hundreds of species of animals – from geckos and snakes to white-t
titles: Where the Wild Things Are: Wildlife Management with Johnson’s Matt Strausser

The center is home to hundreds of animal species, including geckos, snakes, and white-tailed deer. This unexpected aspect of the space center highlights its role as a habitat for various animals alongside its primary function in space exploration.
